DOC.brief_summary: Safety effectiveness JUVÉDERM™ Injectable Gel Lidocaine compare JUVÉDERM™ without Lidocaine procedural pain treatment nasolabial fold .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Effectiveness JUVÉDERM™ Injectable Gel With Lidocaine
DOC.detailed_description: Controlled , randomize , split-face study subject receive JUVÉDERM™ Injectable Gel Lidocaine ( Ultra Ultra Plus ) one nasolabial fold JUVÉDERM™ Injectable Gel without Lidocaine ( Ultra Ultra Plus ) nasolabial fold . The investigator determine whether subject receives JUVÉDERM™ Ultra Ultra Plus per level correction desire ; lidocaine assignment randomize .
DOC.criteria: Be male female , 18 year age old Desire correction moderate severe nasolabial fold ( NLFs ) Have approximately symmetrical NLFs , i.e. , NLFs pretreatment NLF severity score Have undergo cosmetic facial procedure low 2/3 face within 1 month prior entry study plan undergo procedure study . Begin use new overthecounter prescription , oral topical , antiwrinkle product NLF area within 1 month prior enrollment plan begin use product study . Have undergone previous hyaluronic acid ( HA ) base dermal filler treatment total volume HA inject within 12 month prior study entry within 5 mL recommend annual maximum volume HA dermal filler . Has ever receive semipermanent filler permanent facial implant anywhere face neck , plan implant product study . Have history anaphylaxis , multiple severe allergy , atopy , allergy lidocaine ( amidebased anesthetic ) , hyaluronic acid product , Streptococcal protein , plan undergo desensitization therapy term study . Have active inflammation , infection , cancerous precancerous lesion , unhealed wound NLF area
